text: {| class="wikitable floatright" style="font-size: 0.9em;" |+ Minor planets discovered: 705 |- | see |} is a Japanese astronomer and discoverer of minor planets from Sapporo, in the northernmost prefecture of Japan. Kaneda ranks among the world's most prolific individual discoverers of minor planets. He is credited by the Minor Planet Center with the co-discovery of 705 numbered minor planets, between 1987 and 2000, all of them in collaboration with astronomer Seiji Ueda. Along with being an astronomer, Kaneda works as a computer programmer and is a developer of astronomical software. The main-belt asteroid 4677 Hiroshi, discovered by Atsushi Takahashi and Kazur≈ç Watanabe at Kitami in 1990, is named after him. == List of discovered minor planets == His many minor planet discoveries include (5646) 1990 TR, a near-Earth object of the Amor group, , an asteroid from the main-belt, (5407) 1992 AX, a Mars- crossing asteroid, (7352) 1994 CO, a Jupiter trojan, as well as the three named main-belt asteroids 4672 Takuboku, 5176 Yoichi and 6235 Burney (the latter was not named by him). As of 2016, most of his numbered discoveries remain unnamed (see table below). All minor planets were co-discovered with Seiji Ueda. {| class="wikitable" style="font-size: 89%; float: left; width: 24em; margin-right: 1em; line-height: 1.65em !important; height: 675px; |- | 3720 Hokkaido || 28 October 1987|| |- | 4000 Hipparchus || 4 January 1989|| |- | 4096 Kushiro || 15 November 1987|| |- | 4127 Kyogoku || 25 January 1988|| |- | 4155 Watanabe || 25 October 1987|| |- | 4215 Kamo || 14 November 1987|| |- | 4260 Yanai || 4 January 1989|| |- | 4282 Endate || 28 October 1987|| |- | 4284 Kaho || 16 March 1988|| |- | 4343 Tetsuya || 10 January 1988|| |- | 4350 Shibecha || 26 October 1989|| |- | 4410 Kamuimintara || 17 December 1989|| |- | 4454 Kumiko || 2 November 1988|| |- | 4455 Ruriko || 2 December 1988|| |- | 4494 Marimo || 13 October 1988|| |- | 4500 Pascal || 3 February 1989|| |- | 4631 Yabu || 22 November 1987|| |- | 4672 Takuboku || 17 April 1988|| |- | 4719 Burnaby || 21 November 1990|| |- | 4720 Tottori || 19 December 1990|| |- | 4747 Jujo || 19 November 1989|| |- | 4774 Hobetsu || 14 February 1991|| |- | 4842 Atsushi || 21 November 1989|| |- | 4844 Matsuyama || 23 January 1991|| |- | 4863 Yasutani || 13 November 1987|| |} {| class="wikitable" style="font-size: 89%;
